alert.note: Alert for Redwood; Renville (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 9:29PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Morton affecting Renville and Redwood Counties. .Accumulating rainfall has occurred across southern Minnesota Friday night into this evening. Totals so far have reached 2 to even 4 plus inches in some localized areas with additional rainfall expected tonight. This has caused river levels in this region to either rapidly rise or delay falling. Crests should occur within the next few days before a dry pattern this coming week allows for river decreases again. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Morton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Riverside Rd and Front Street flooded in North Redwood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Saturday, the stage was 21.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 PM CDT Saturday was 21.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.1 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.0 feet on 10/12/2018. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
